turns.speaker: VET 2
turns.text: Down I would say... What would you say?

turns.speaker: VET 1
turns.text: Down.

turns.speaker: VET 2
turns.text: Down ribbon!

turns.speaker: VET 1
turns.text: Up a little there... What would you say?

turns.speaker: VET 2
turns.text: Up.

turns.speaker: BENNETT
turns.text: Looks like ya gonna take office just in time, Chief.  Things need straightening up in this city.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: What'cha got, Bennett?

turns.speaker: BENNETT
turns.text: Witnesses say some wacko went Judge hunting with a late model.  I got an artist working on a computer composite now.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Technothugs?

turns.speaker: BENNETT
turns.text: No chance.  Not their sector.  They ain't even into things this big. Our zone-boy's performing out of a horror show.  Something else.  Unit nine found a couple cold ones in Hollywood.  One Manny Turner.  Gun runner. Sounds like a connection to me.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: I can smell it.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: That's him.  Simon Doucet.

turns.speaker: BENNETT
turns.text: Jesus.  Sweet Jesus.  We've got trouble.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: This monster escaped from Cryo- Prison this morning.

turns.speaker: BENNETT
turns.text: Well, he's sure working fast ain't he?

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: I want this bastard brought down.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: BENNETT
turns.text: Wade's here.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Talk fast.  Polls open in half an hour.

turns.speaker: BENNETT
turns.text: Wade did a little reminiscing.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Michael called yesterday.  He wants to take Willy for the summer.

turns.speaker: CASSY
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I'd think about it.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Mr. Murphy asked about you again at work yesterday.

turns.speaker: CASSY
turns.text: He just wants me to make him cinnamon cookies like I made for you.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I think he wants more than your cookies.

turns.speaker: CASSY
turns.text: Kimberly!

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Mom, I hate to break this to you, but there's a whole other species out there you're neglecting.  If you've forgotten, they're called 'men'.  Sometimes referred to in more colorful language.

turns.speaker: DUBBS
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Avon Lady!

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: My man Dubbs.

turns.speaker: DUBBS
turns.text: Who are you?  What the fuck do you want?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: I want to ask you a few questions.

turns.speaker: DUBBS
turns.text: No, you're not model material.  Anything else?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Funny guy.

turns.speaker: DUBBS
turns.text: Fuck you - fuck you.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: You helped set up my partner, Sergeant William Wade.  I want to know who put you up to it.

turns.speaker: DUBBS
turns.text: Your mother.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Speak up.

turns.speaker: DUBBS
turns.text: It was Wade's old partner... Gallagher. He was behind it all.

turns.speaker: DUBBS
turns.text: I worked for him... still do.  Said he'd make sure I was left alone if I helped put Wade away.  He kept his promise for twenty years.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Prepare for a change in lifestyle.

turns.speaker: DUBBS
turns.text: It was Wade's old partner... Gallagher. He was behind it all.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Put that on your political resume.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Looks like you did more than jackoff while I was gone.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Maybe re-animating you wasn't such a bright idea.  You look like shit.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Shucks, and I got all dressed up.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Twenty years have passed, Wade. Lay it to rest.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I was set up and you know it... but you swore under oath I was dirty. You helped bury me.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Jury found you guilty, not me.  I just called it as I saw it.  Fuck that.  You were brought here for a reason.  Doucet's escaped.  Re-animated for his parole hearing.  Killed a lot of people.  Most of them cops.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'm not on the force anymore.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Well, you've just been taken off the bench.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I want to see my wife and kid.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Later.  I want Doucet first.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I told you.  I'm out of the cops and robbers business.  Retired twenty years ago.  I've been trained as a bus driver.  Got a whole route planned and everything.  Even nailed down the lingo - '<u>Exact change, please</u>'.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: I'm going to bring this down hard. I've got an A-1 badass killer loose, an election day after tomorrow, and I'm risking everything on you. You're going to bring him in.  I don't care how.  If you do, you'll get your freedom.  An official pardon from me.  A clean slate.  A good job.  A chance to get back with your family.  If you don't want to, I'll put your ass back in the freezer so fast, you'll forget you were ever defrosted.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Fill it out.  Standard issue mal- practice insurance.  All Cops carry it.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Mug sheets.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I remember what he looks like.  I can't forget.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Edicon system made these.  Ages, photographs.  We use it to find missing children.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: He's not that old yet.  You've lost confidence in me.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: No, but he's going to be by tomorrow. He's aging.  'Bout the entire twenty years lost while being frozen in forty-eight hours.  In that time he'll be an old man.  Could be a year, an hour, or all at once. Called NPA Syndrome.  Natural Pro- gression of Aging.  It affects each individual differently.  I'm sure it's painful.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You son-of-a-bitch.  How do you stop it?

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: We have an antidote that'll retard the aging process.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Give it to me.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: When you bring in Doucet.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: The faster you get Doucet, the younger you'll be.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'm going to kill you when this is all over.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: You're working a partner on this.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I've been alone for twenty years. I don't feel very sociable.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Hello Wade.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Out of the room.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Tell Frick and Frack that means them too.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: I'll be alright.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: You can't kill me.  I'm going to be Mayor tomorrow.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'm not voting for you.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Ah, fuck you, Wade.  This is bull- shit.  You're not going to kill me.  You're not going to risk your freedom.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I want to stop aging.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: And I want Doucet.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: This is a war, Wade.  You against him.  Vengeance time.  The City's just in the way.  Kill the fucker. You and me.  We'll work things out when the time is right.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Remember my promise.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Don't threaten me.  I tend to take these things seriously.  And get a couple hours sleep.  You look like day old shit.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Got compliments coming outta your ass, don't ya?

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Just got the call.  Took him from school.  Bastard nailed the Vice- Principal and a teacher.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'm wasting time.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: You can't win like this.  You'll only get older.  This is what you wanted!

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Not anymore.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: What is it?  I'm about to go on.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: We have to talk.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: I heard about today.  Good job.  I'm all for capital punishment.  Why don't you go home and see your family?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: That wasn't your plan, was it?

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You were planning to send me back to the ice house.  You set me up.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: <u>You</u> were the dirty cop... and I was on to you.  You panicked.  Afraid I was going to expose you... so you shut me up.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: I don't want to hear anymore.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You stole the heroin out of the evidence room and planted it on me.  I was iced.  What better way to keep me from talking.  Stop me if I'm wrong.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: That's not your zone.  Stick to data entry.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: I was part of the escort team that re-animated him.  My partner's dead because of this guy.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Wade's in Cryo-Prison.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: He could be brought back.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Kill him... kill him.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Simon Doucet.  You are under arrest. Please come out with your hands in the air.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Doucet's just offed two of the jurors who put him away.  I'm rounding up the rest of them and putting them in police custody.  What's your status?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: We seem to've come across a 211, sir.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Forget it.  Stick to the program.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: You two fucks listen up.  Doucet's killing people and you're wasting valuable time busting two-bit Technothugs.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: But sir, Sergeant Wade saved the hostages.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: I'm thrilled beyond belief.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Sir, your transmission's fading.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: You have no evidence.  Arrest this man.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: You want evidence.  I'll give you evidence.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: What do you mean he's escaped?! They're not supposed to escape!

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: It's a real mess down here.  Some- thing must a'gone wrong.  No man could possess that kind of strength after being frozen for twenty years.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Tell Doucet that.  What was his rehabilitation training?

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Telephone repairman.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Just great.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: NPA syndrome will hit 'im fast.  Have your men gear up the Edicon system at a twenty-year ratio in fractions of fives.  Saying a prayer won't be bad either.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: I don't want any press on this.  I've got an election to win day after to- morrow.

turns.speaker: PEEBLES
turns.text: Sir, your dinner with the union leaders begins in an hour.  Your wife will meet you there, so we can leave whenever you're ready.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: PEEBLES
turns.text: I've also drafted a letter to families of officers killed in the line of duty.  They'll need your signature.

turns.speaker: PEEBLES
turns.text: Sir, your limo's here.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Kill me if you want.  Hard line me with that 'I ain't got nothing to lose' bullshit.  But you've got plenty to lose 'partner'.  You've got a family.  I'm giving you a chance to see them.  I kept in touch.  She never married. All these years.  Maybe she loves you.  I wouldn't know why.

turns.speaker: PEEBLES
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: How do I look?

turns.speaker: PEEBLES
turns.text: Aces.

turns.speaker: PEEBLES
turns.text: Okay, that's all folks.  Commissioner Gallagher has to go.

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Keep 'em busy.

turns.speaker: PEEBLES
turns.text: Sir---

turns.speaker: GALLAGHER
turns.text: Shut up!  Drop it.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Need help?

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: I got it.  I got it.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You sure?  I can help you.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Ah Mom, you're embarrass'n me.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Nobody's looking.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Go in the house.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Maybe I should put on the training whe---

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Not the 'T' word.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Ooops, I forgot.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You my partner?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Officer Hector Sanchez, Sergeant. Hillside Academy.  Status G-8. Security Clearance 3.  One year Advance Technical Crime Analyst. Weapons Assistant.  FDA Junior Captain, Hollywood division---

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Are you a cop?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Well, that's good enough for me.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I drive.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Commissioner Gallagher gave me specific orders not to let you drive until you re-familiarize yourself with the process and territory.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'm ready.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: But Sergeant...

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Give me a break, Sanchez.  It's like riding a bike.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Does it drive itself, too?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: You have to use the steering wheel to turn.  The pedal for gas...

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Got it.  Ejection seat?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Whoa.  Don't touch that.  <u>Pursuit</u> <u>Mode</u>.  Auto pilot.  Computerized steering and driving system used in high speed pursuits.  Installed Fall 2006.  Underground rumor has it they modeled it after you, sir.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Lean year for role models.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I have to go home, Sanchez.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Commissioner Gallagher said...  ...twenty years is a long time.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: No offense, but why'd they partner me with a rookie?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Doucet killed my partner.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: See those guys?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Technothugs.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: They're going to rob that bank.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Some things never change.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: I'll inform dispatch.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: There's no time.  There are civilians in there.  It's about to go down.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: We don't know that for sure.  We'll have to wait until they move.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Well, I'm sure.  You're a cop.  I'm a cop.  Let's do what cops do.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: You can't turn him off.  He's the Commissioner.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'm not fond of television comedies.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Wanna come?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: My insurance won't cover it.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Thanks.  Want'a bite?  McDonald's vegiroll.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Pass.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: When you're frozen, you're legally dead, right?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Then what goes on in there?  What I mean is, what are you thinking about?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Bacon cheeseburgers.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Give me a break.  I'm serious. What's it like to be dead?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Trust me.  You don't want to know.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Hey, buddy...

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Relax, let technology do the work.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: NPA metamorphosis should biologically slow him down.  That's when we'll get him.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You can't catch this man with a computer.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: How then?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You don't follow the bodies, and you don't follow procedure.  You do it by instinct.  Think like him.  Do what has to be dane.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Sir, I took the liberty of running a GCI scenario on a TM-1 earlier today...

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: GCI.  TM-1.  What language are you talking?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: I also PVC'd you.  Youngest Officer promoted to Sergeant. Two CMs.  Four honor medals...

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Drop it.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I was set up.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: You're saying you were put away for a crime you didn't commit?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: 'Bout the same time I busted Doucet I tried to nail this big-time dealer. I didn't have an ID, but I was close. Too close.  Gained the confidence of a badass named Dubbs.  He was going to turn me onto the big man.  He made me for a cop.  Mysteriously my fellow officers discovered ten pounds of heroin in my cruiser.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: It doesn't make sense.  Who would want to do that to you?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Nothing makes sense when you're a cop.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Married?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Engaged.  Plan on doing it this summer.  You still married?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah.  Least I think so.  Twenty- six years this March.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: What's this place?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: This is where I found Doucet twenty years ago.  Thought maybe he'd come back.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Hey, Rip Van Winkle, maybe we'd better call it a night.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: She's pretty.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: You need anything else?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'll be okay.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Good night, Wade.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'll have a cup of coffee?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Never use it.  Stuff'll kill ya.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: No.  Talk English.  Then I'll understand.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: We get to peek into Doucet's brain.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Hey, I'm eating.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: I'm serious, Wade.  This case is important to me.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You want to be a good detective?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Then find me some cigarettes.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Two lousy smokes.  You're a real sport.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: That cost me two weeks' pay.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Maybe I should turn myself in.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Lighten up.  You're going to give yourself an ulcer.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Part of Doucet's cerebellum, a portion called the vermis is under- developed.  This area rates response to outside stimuli.  Com- pare it to that of a normal law- abiding citizen.  It could be why he kills.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Great.  My partner's Marcus Welby.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: I'm just doing it by the book. Analyze then vaporize.  Crime's a science.  Everything's analyzed.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: With all this technology you don't even have to show up for work.  Who needs cops when you've got gizmos.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: You're just afraid to use this.  You have technophobia, Wade.  That's what you got.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Wanna try?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: No thank you, sir.  Smoking causes lung cancer, heart disease, emphysema, and may complicate pregnancy.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You're not pregnant, are you?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Let's roll.  We got a guy who swears his car was stolen by a suspect identical to Doucet. 0800 this morning.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What else did he get?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Wallet, cash, I.D...

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Fire up that thing of yours and tell me all credit card trans- actions after eight o'clock.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Kid, you ever been in a high speed chase before?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Simulated one.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Get us some fuck'n back-up now!

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: <u>Comwatch Dispatch System</u>.  Can't assimilate voice stress.  Code priority only.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Rip Van Winkle.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: How ya feeling?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: How do I look?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Not too good.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: We're partners, aren't we?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Sanchez...?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You treat her nice.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: ...What are you talking about...?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Your girl.  Being a cop will be rough on her.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: ...Have you been drinking?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: This should make your day.  The guy who testified against you... Dubbs... was arrested a total number of twenty- four times.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: So, he's got a thing for prison clothes.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: That's just it.  He never did time. Seems each arrest was botched for one reason or another.  Judge threw out the cases each time.  Either he's got a horseshoe up his ass or powerful friends.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Aaah... Mother of Jesus.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What is it?  Your legs?  Hands?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Hospital food.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What are you doing this for, Sanchez?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: If you were set up, I want to find out who did it.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: I just heard.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: He's got my grandson, Sanchez.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: You be careful.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: I'm signing off.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: No.  I want to be with you.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: No you don't.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You should be in hospital.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: And you should be with your family.

turns.speaker: SHEPPARD
turns.text: Jesus, Sanchez... what do you think you're doin'?  That's flatfoot data. You're not supposed to have access to that.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: This is the guy that killed my partner.

turns.speaker: SHEPPARD
turns.text: You startin' a fan club or some- thin'?

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Says here one of our boys brought him down.  You ever heard of a badge named Wade?

turns.speaker: SHEPPARD
turns.text: Demolition Man.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: What's it mean?

turns.speaker: SHEPPARD
turns.text: You never want to find out.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Take a look at this.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: He had a partner.  Our own Ray Gallagher.  He tagged Wade dangerously defiant. Psychotic.  Reckless.  Seems our Commissioner didn't like him much. Busted his buns on a narcotic's violation.  Wade was sentenced to twenty-five years.

turns.speaker: SHEPPARD
turns.text: He went dirty and they made an example of him.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: But he was such a good cop.

turns.speaker: SHEPPARD
turns.text: They always are.

turns.speaker: SANCHEZ
turns.text: Well I've got news for you.  This dirty cop was the <u>only cop</u> who could bag Doucet.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Seat's too high.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: My mom says I'm gonna grow.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: My granddad was a policeman.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: I'm going to be a policeman.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: William Simpson.  I like Willy.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Good to know you, Willy.

turns.speaker: WILLY
turns.text: Bye.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Remember, get the seat fixed.

turns.speaker: WHORE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: WHORE
turns.text: Haven't seen you around.  Where have you been all my life, handsome?

turns.speaker: WHORE
turns.text: Funny.  Would you like to buy me a drink?

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: This little thing says I can't.

turns.speaker: WHORE
turns.text: You could always take it off.

turns.speaker: WADE
turns.text: It's stuck, but thanks for the offer.
